abstracts.cdata!:
The Andhra Pradesh Community Forest
            Management Project aims to consolidate and expand the
            benefits of the Joint Forest Management implemented
            involving local forest community through Vana Samrakshana
            Samithies (VSS). The project will employ community-driven
            development approach, where community will be empowered to
            take all decisions for protecting and developing forests.
            All the VSS have been assigned forest areas for protection
            and development. Therefore, no new land acquisition is
            envisaged to undertake project interventions. Furthermore,
            no physical displacement is expected. The main issue is
            encroachment in the forest areas mainly for agriculture
            purpose. There are likely to be some adverse effects or
            impacts on the families and people in the form of losing the
            encroached land in the forests under management of VSS and
            their livelihood source. This Resettlement Action Plan (RAP)
            is prepared to describe the process how the resettlement
            issues will be addressed. VSS communities facilitated by
            NGOs will carry out the process of social assessment. About
            28 percent of the families are likely to be affected, nearly
            28 percent will be landless largely dependent on encroached
            lands for meeting their household food requirements. It is
            expected that some families encroaching forest land will
            resist surrendering land. The approach proposed to be
            adopted is to promote surrender of encroached forest land
            required under no compulsions and pressure on the affected families.
